page.title: 03DOMESTIC BUILDINGS, N CREAKE
page.content: Most of the dwellings in N Creake are cottage-type, of clunch or chalk, with brick quoins, and flint facing. As there is no building stone in N Norfolk, one does not find the ancient houses of the limestone or granite districts of the country. Although the village is not in a conservation area, most of the houses that have been built in recent years, have been faced with flint in the traditional style of the district, with casement windows, and pantiles roofs. About one third of all village homes are council houses, built of brick. There is one large farmhouse that could be one of the former manor houses. The very large former Rectory was sold by the church authorities, and has been on the market for some time.
